title: The Power of Cycles vs. Checklists
excerpt: Checklists end. Cycles continue. Design loops that preserve momentum.
text: Checklists end. Cycles continue. When work is cyclical, there’s no “now what?”—you always know the next step. Cycle sketch Try it with a weekly review loop: capture → triage → plan → execute → reflect. Audio version: {{soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/artist/your track}}

title: Welcome to the miniCycle Blog — Build Systems, Not Just Tasks
excerpt: Systems over willpower. Simple, repeatable workflows using cycles, cues, and constraints.
text: Welcome This blog is about one idea: systems over willpower. We’ll share short, practical posts you can apply today. Start with your smallest reliable loop, then scale. Cue: Define the trigger. Cycle: Define the steps. Constraint: Limit scope to keep momentum. Further reading: Product
